algorithms.name: process the dir member
algorithms.html: To process the dir member, given ordered map json and ordered map manifest:

steps.html: Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["dir"] to "auto".
If json["dir"] doesn't exist or if json["dir"] is not a string, return.
If text-direction list doesn't contain json["dir"], return.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["dir"] to <var data-type="ordered map">json</var>["dir"].

algorithms.name: process the lang member
algorithms.html: To process the lang member, given ordered map json and ordered map manifest:

steps.html: If json["lang"] doesn't exist or if json["lang"] is not a string, return.
If calling IsStructurallyValidLanguageTag with json["lang"] returns false, return.
Set manifest["lang"] to the result of calling the CanonicalizeUnicodeLocaleId abstract operation with json["lang"].

algorithms.name: process the scope member
algorithms.html: To process the scope member, given ordered map json and ordered map manifest:

steps.html: Set manifest["scope"] to the result of parsing "." with manifest["start_url"] as the base URL.
If <var data-type="ordered map">json</var>["scope"] is the empty string, then return.
Let scope be the result of parsing json["scope"] with manifest URL as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">scope</var> is failure, return.
Set scope's query and fragment to null.
If manifest["start_url"] is not within scope of scope, return.
Otherwise, set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["scope"] to <var data-type="URL">scope</var>.

algorithms.name: process the display member
algorithms.html: To process the display member, given ordered map json and ordered map manifest:

steps.html: Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["display"] to "browser".
If json["display"] doesn't exist or json["display"] is not a a string, return.
If display modes list doesn't contain json["display"], return.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["display"] to <var data-type="ordered map">json</var>["display"].

algorithms.name: process the orientation member
algorithms.html: To process the orientation member, given ordered map json and ordered map manifest:

steps.html: If json["orientation"] doesn't exist or json["orientation"] is not a string, return.
If json["orientation"] doesn't contain any of the orientation values, return.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["orientation"] to <var data-type="ordered map">json</var>["orientation"].

algorithms.name: process the start_url member
algorithms.html: To process the start_url member, given ordered map json, ordered map manifest, URL manifest URL, and URL document URL:

steps.html: Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["start_url"] to <var data-type="URL">document URL</var>.
If json["start_url"] doesn't exist or json["start_url"] is not a string, return.
If the type of json["start_url"] is not string, or if json["start_url"] is the empty string, return.
Let start URL be the result of parsing json["start_url"], using manifest URL as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">start URL</var> is failure, return.
If start URL is not same origin as document URL, return.
Otherwise, set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["start_url"] to <var data-type="URL">start URL</var>.

algorithms.name: process the id member
algorithms.html: To process the id member, given ordered map json, ordered map manifest:

steps.html: Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["id"] to <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["start_url"].
If the type of json["id"] is not string, return.
If <var data-type="JSON">json</var>["id"] is the empty string, return.
Let base origin be manifest["start_url"]'s origin.
Let id be the result of parsing json["id"] with base origin as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">id</var> is failure, return.
If id is not same origin as manifest["start_url"], return.
Set id's fragment to null.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["id"] to <var data-type="URL">id</var>.

algorithms.name: process the related_applications member
algorithms.html: To process the related_applications member, given ordered map json and ordered map manifest:

steps.html: Let relatedApplications be a new list.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["related_applications"] to <var data-type="list">relatedApplications</var>.
If json["related_applications"] doesn't exist or json["related_applications"] is not a list, return.
For each app of json["related_applications"]:

If neither <var>app</var>["id"] nor <var>app</var>["url"] are
              missing:
Set app["url"] to the result of running process the url member of an application given app["url"].
append app to relatedApplications.
Set <var data-type="list">relatedApplications</var>.

algorithms.name: process the shortcuts member
algorithms.html: To process the shortcuts member, given ordered map json, ordered map manifest, and URL manifest URL:

steps.html: Let processedShortcuts be a new list.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">manifest</var>["shortcuts"] to <var data-type="list">processedShortcuts</var>.
If json["shortcuts"] doesn't exist or json["shortcuts"] is not a list, return.
For each entry of json["shortcuts"]:
Let shortcut be process a shortcut with entry and manifest["scope"].
If <var data-type="ordered map">shortcut</var> is failure, continue.
Append shortcut to processedShortcuts.

algorithms.name: Document/processed manifest
algorithms.html: The steps for processing a manifest are given by the following algorithm. The algorithm takes a URL document URL, a URL manifest URL, and a byte sequence bodyBytes.

steps.html: Let json be the result of parse JSON bytes to an Infra value passing bodyBytes.
If the json is a parsing exception, or json is not an ordered map:
Set json to an empty ordered map.
Let manifest be an empty ordered map.
Process the dir member passing json and manifest.
Process the lang member passing json and manifest.
Process a text member passing json, manifest, and "name".
Process a text member passing json, manifest, and "short_name".
Process the start_url member passing json, manifest, manifest URL, and document URL.
Process the id member passing json and manifest.
If the document's processed manifest is not null, and document's processed manifest's id is not equal to manifest["id"], return.
Process the scope member passing json, manifest, and manifest URL.
Process a color member passing json, manifest, and "theme_color".
Process a color member passing json, manifest, and "background_color".
Process the display member passing json and manifest.
Process image resources passing json["icons"], manifest, manifest URL, and "icons".
Process the orientation member passing json, manifest.
Process the related_applications member passing json and manifest.
Process the shortcuts member passing json, manifest, and manifest URL.
Processing extension-point: process any proprietary and/or other supported members at this point in the algorithm.
Let document's processed manifest be manifest.

algorithms.name: process a color member
algorithms.html: To process a color member, using ordered map json, ordered map map, and string member:

steps.html: If json[member] doesn't exist or json[member] is not a string, return.
Let color be the result of parsing the value of json[member] as a CSS color.
If <var>color</var> is failure, return.
If color can be converted to sRGB using solely information the user agent inherently knows, then convert color to sRGB.
If color is not sRGB color, return.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">map</var>[member] to <var>color</var>.

algorithms.name: process a text member
algorithms.html: To process a text member, given ordered map json, ordered map map, and string member:

steps.html: If json[member] doesn't exists or json[member] is not a string, return.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">map</var>[member] to the value of <var data-type="ordered map">json</var>[<var data-type="string">member</var>].

algorithms.name: determine the purpose of an image
algorithms.html: To determine the purpose of an image, given ordered map json:

steps.html: If json["purpose"] doesn't exist or if json["purpose"] is not a string:
Return set « "any" ».
Let keywords be the result of split on ASCII whitespace json["purpose"].
Let purposes be new set.
For each keyword of keywords:
If icon purposes list doesn't contain keyword, then continue.
Otherwise, append keyword to purposes.
If purposes is empty, then return failure.
Return <var data-type="set">purposes</var>.

algorithms.name: process image resources
algorithms.html: To process image resources, given list images, ordered map map, manifest URL and string member:

steps.html: Let imageResources be a new list.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">map</var>[member] to <var data-type="List<Image Resources>">imageResources</var>.
If images is not list, return.
For each potential image of images:
Let image be the result of running process an image resource from JSON given potential image and manifest URL.
If image is failure, continue.
Let purposes be determine the purpose of an image passing potential image.
If purposes is failure, continue.
Set <var data-type="ordered map">image</var>["purpose"] to <var data-type="set">purposes</var>.
Append image to imageResources.

algorithms.name: process a shortcut
algorithms.html: To process a shortcut, given ordered map item and scope,:

steps.html:
Return failure if it's the case that:
  • item is not ordered map.
  • item["name"] doesn't exist.
  • item["name"] is the empty string.
  • item["url"] doesn't exist.
  • item["url"] is not a string.
Let url be the result of parsing item["url"] with manifest URL as the base URL.
If <var data-type="URL">url</var> is failure, return failure.
If url is not within scope of scope, return failure.

Let <var data-type="ordered map">shortcut</var> be <var>ordered map</var> «[ "url" → <var data-type="URL">url</var>,
          "name" → <var data-type="ordered
          map">item</var>["name"] ]».
Process image resources passing item["icons"], shortcut, manifest URL, and "icons".
Return <var data-type="ordered map">shortcut</var>.

algorithms.name: process the url member of an application
algorithms.html: To process the url member of an application:

steps.html: If <var>application URL</var> is missing, return null.
Otherwise, parse application URL and if the result is not failure, return the result. Otherwise return null.

algorithms.html: Other specifications MAY replace this algorithm's steps with their own steps. This replacement will take effect for all invocations of launch a web application.

steps.html: Return the result of running the steps to create a new application context passing manifest, target URL and POST resource.

algorithms.name: create a new application context
algorithms.html: The steps to create a new application context is given by the following algorithm. The algorithm takes a processed manifest manifest, an optional URL target URL, an optional POST resource POST resource and returns an application context.

steps.html: If target URL was not given, set target URL to start URL.
Let traversable be the result of running the steps to create a fresh top-level traversable with target URL and POST resource.
Let browsing context be the traversable's active browsing context.
Apply manifest to browsing context.
Return <var>browsing context</var>.

algorithms.name: URL/within scope
algorithms.html: A URL target is said to be within scope of URL scope if the following algorithm returns true:

steps.html: If target and scope are not same origin, return false.
Let scopePath be the concatenation of scopes's path using U+002F (/) as the separator.
Let targetPath be the concatenation of target's path using U+002F (/) as the separator.
Return a boolean indicating whether targetPath starts with scopePath.

algorithms.name: steps for determining the web app's chosen display mode
algorithms.html: The steps for determining the web app's chosen display mode is given by the following algorithm. The algorithm takes a processed manifest manifest and returns a display mode.

steps.html: processing extension-point: process any proprietary and/or other supported display modes at this point in the algorithm.

If the user agent supports <var data-type="processed manifest">manifest</var>["display"], then return
        <var data-type="processed manifest">manifest</var>["display"].
For each fallback_mode of the fallback chain of manifest["display"]:

If the user agent supports the <var>fallback_mode</var>, then return
            <var>fallback_mode</var>.
